alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 05 at 5:39PM MST until January 06 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST /8 AM CST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow, blowing snow, and northerly wind gusts up to 35 mph, mainly this evening. Total snow accumulations ranging anywhere from 1 to 6 inches, greatest in southwest Nebraska. Wind chill temperatures ranging from 15 to 25 degrees below zero this evening through late Thursday morning. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas, northeast Colorado and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, this evening and tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, this evening through late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions. Frostbite and hypothermia. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As of 5 PM MST, the heaviest snow has largely been confined to southwest Nebraska and adjacent Kansas border counties. 4 to 6 inches of snow has already fallen in Hitchcock and Red Willow counties, with 2 to 3 inches in Norton county.
info.instruction: If you must travel, slow down, turn off cruise control, and exercise additional caution, particularly at intersections and highway on-ramps and off-ramps where accidents are more likely to occur. Decelerating abruptly or making sharp turns at a high rate of speed may result in loss of vehicle control. Use caution while traveling outside. Dress in layers, including a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
